intro: Tragia involucrata, commonly known as the prickly stick or false huito, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its branched, spiny stems and small, hairy leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Tragia involucrata is adapted to withstand drought and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
